hello can anyone help with my android searchview? i really need some help
<@U0L565VU3|thanhbc> has joined the channel

Hey everyone. I'm having an issue fully collapsing an AppBarLayout.  This is my layout:
```
<android.support.design.widget.CoordinatorLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
             xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
             android:layout_width="match_parent"
             android:layout_height="match_parent">
    <com.devbrackets.android.exomedia.EMVideoView
        android:id="@+id/video_view"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="match_parent"
        app:defaultControlsEnabled="true"/>

    <android.support.design.widget.AppBarLayout
        android:id="@+id/playback_app_bar_layout"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:theme="@style/ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark.ActionBar"
        android:background="@color/black_overlay">

        <include layout="@layout/toolbar_default" />

    </android.support.design.widget.AppBarLayout>
</android.support.design.widget.CoordinatorLayout>
```
The video view has callback listeners when the controls are shown/hidden and I'm using these methods:
```
playbackAppBarLayout.setExpanded(true, true)
// and
playbackAppBarLayoutSetExpanded(false, true)
```
My issue is that when the AppBarLayout collapses, it seems to only go so far and part of it remains on screen (like as if there was a status bar)
I should mention that these are the flags I'm using within `setSystemUiVisibility`
```
View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LAYOUT_STABLE
|| View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LAYOUT_HIDE_NAVIGATION
|| View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_LAYOUT_FULLSCREEN
|| View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION
|| View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_FULLSCREEN
|| View.KEEP_SCREEN_ON
|| View.SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_IMMERSIVE_STICKY
```
<@U0P285BDJ|ryancmcmanus> has joined the channel
<@U0DU1GQTV>: i remember running into this issue before too, i’m digging around to see what i did.
i don’t remember if i have that code anymore or not to look back on though.  i’ll see what i can find for you
<@U0DU1GQTV>: try putting this in your EMVideoView — app:layout_behavior="@string/appbar_scrolling_view_behavior"
when you scroll does it disappear fully, or does it still do what you described?

<@U0MKPH43Y>: the video view should be full screen, so I wanted the appbar to overlay and show/hide when the video controls were shown/hidden. I figured out I was using the wrong system ui flags. I only wanted `SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_FULLSCREEN` and `SYSTEM_UI_FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION`
oh ok, glad you got it figured out!
TIL not to be aggressive with flags
<@U0NQ6CY8G|crispy> has joined the channel

<@U0KC373GX|noel> has joined the channel
If I am on an Adapter class, how do I get a Layout (like a linear layout) on the parent activity of that adapter?
i tend to pass an instance of my presenter into my adapter and viewholders, then use that to communicate with my parent view (the fragment or whatever)
alternatively you could just pass the view into your adapter and use it directly
